title: Rising Oil Prices Put Biden in a Bind Over Climate Pledges
sub_head: White House mulls its limited options to boost supply; critics say situation exposes flaws in president’s climate-change agenda set out at COP26
body:
Rising oil prices have handed President Biden a dilemma at a politically precarious time.
His administration’s ambitious agenda to stem global warming calls for a shift away from fossil fuels. Yet Mr. Biden is now urging the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries to increase production to ease shortages and lower prices.
